alert.note: Alert for Dinwiddie; Eastern Chesterfield (Including Col. Heights); Prince George (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 4:19PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Chesterfield, northwestern Prince George and northeastern Dinwiddie Counties, the City of Colonial Heights and the City of Petersburg through 445 PM EDT... At 419 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Matoaca, or near Virginia State University, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Petersburg, Colonial Heights, Fort Lee, Virginia State University, Sutherland, Ettrick, Matoaca, Petersburg Airport, Richard Bland College, Burgess, Addison and Petersburg National Battlefield. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.

area.areaDesc: Dinwiddie; Eastern Chesterfield (Including Col. Heights); Prince George
